members.name: backgroundColor
members.descriptionHtml: Background color for the beak and callout.

members.name: beakWidth
members.descriptionHtml: Width of Callout beak

members.name: calloutMaxWidth
members.descriptionHtml: Max width for callout including borders.

members.name: calloutWidth
members.descriptionHtml: Width for callout including borders.

members.name: className
members.descriptionHtml: CSS class to apply to the callout.

members.name: overflowYHidden
members.descriptionHtml: Whether or not to clip content of the callout, if it overflows vertically.

members.name: positions
members.descriptionHtml: Callout positioning data

members.name: theme
members.descriptionHtml: Theme to apply to the calloutContent.

members.name: beak
members.descriptionHtml: Style for callout beak.

members.name: beakCurtain
members.descriptionHtml: Style for callout beak curtain.

members.name: calloutMain
members.descriptionHtml: Style for content component of the callout.

members.name: container
members.descriptionHtml: Style for wrapper of Callout component.

members.name: root
members.descriptionHtml: Style for callout container root element.

members.name: alignTargetEdge
members.descriptionHtml: If true the positioning logic will prefer to flip edges rather than to nudge the rectangle to fit within bounds, thus making sure the element aligns perfectly with target's alignment edge

members.name: ariaDescribedBy
members.descriptionHtml: Defines the element id referencing the element containing the description for the callout.

members.name: ariaLabel
members.descriptionHtml: Accessible label text for callout.

members.name: ariaLabelledBy
members.descriptionHtml: Defines the element id referencing the element containing label text for callout.

members.name: backgroundColor
members.descriptionHtml: The background color of the Callout in hex format ie. #ffffff.

members.name: beakWidth
members.descriptionHtml: The width of the beak.

members.name: bounds
members.descriptionHtml: The bounding rectangle for which the contextual menu can appear in.

members.name: calloutMaxHeight
members.descriptionHtml: Set max height of callout When not set the callout will expand with contents up to the bottom of the screen

members.name: calloutMaxWidth
members.descriptionHtml: Custom width for callout including borders. If value is 0, no width is applied.

members.name: calloutWidth
members.descriptionHtml: Custom width for callout including borders. If value is 0, no width is applied.

members.name: className
members.descriptionHtml: CSS class to apply to the callout.

members.name: componentRef
members.descriptionHtml: Optional callback to access the ICallout interface. Use this instead of ref for accessing the public methods and properties of the component.

members.name: coverTarget
members.descriptionHtml: If true the position returned will have the menu element cover the target. If false then it will position next to the target;

members.name: directionalHint
members.descriptionHtml: How the element should be positioned

members.name: directionalHintFixed
members.descriptionHtml: If true the position will not change sides in an attempt to fit the callout within bounds. It will still attempt to align it to whatever bounds are given.

members.name: directionalHintForRTL
members.descriptionHtml: How the element should be positioned in RTL layouts. If not specified, a mirror of `directionalHint` will be used instead

members.name: doNotLayer
members.descriptionHtml: If true do not render on a new layer. If false render on a new layer.

members.name: finalHeight
members.descriptionHtml: Specify the final height of the content. To be used when expanding the content dynamically so that callout can adjust its position.

members.name: gapSpace
members.descriptionHtml: The gap between the Callout and the target

members.name: hidden
members.descriptionHtml: If specified, renders the Callout in a hidden state. Use this flag, rather than rendering a callout conditionally based on visibility, to improve rendering performance when it becomes visible. Note: When callout is hidden its content will not be rendered. It will only render once the callout is visible.

members.name: hideOverflow
members.descriptionHtml: Manually set OverflowYHidden style prop to true on calloutMain element A variety of callout load animations will need this to hide the scollbar that can appear

members.name: isBeakVisible
members.descriptionHtml: If true then the beak is visible. If false it will not be shown.

members.name: layerProps
members.descriptionHtml: Optional props to pass to the Layer component hosting the panel.

members.name: minPagePadding
members.descriptionHtml: The minimum distance the callout will be away from the edge of the screen.

members.name: onDismiss
members.descriptionHtml: Callback when the Callout tries to close.

members.name: onLayerMounted
members.descriptionHtml: Optional callback when the layer content has mounted.

members.name: onPositioned
members.descriptionHtml: Optional callback that is called once the callout has been correctly positioned.

members.name: onScroll
members.descriptionHtml: Callback when the Callout body is scrolled.

members.name: preventDismissOnLostFocus
members.descriptionHtml: If true then the callout will not dismiss when it loses focus

members.name: preventDismissOnResize
members.descriptionHtml: If true then the callout will not dismiss on resize

members.name: preventDismissOnScroll
members.descriptionHtml: If true then the callout will not dismiss on scroll

members.name: role
members.descriptionHtml: Aria role assigned to the callout (Eg. dialog, alertdialog).

members.name: setInitialFocus
members.descriptionHtml: If true then the callout will attempt to focus the first focusable element that it contains. If it doesn't find an element, no focus will be set and the method will return false. This means that it's the contents responsibility to either set focus or have focusable items.

members.name: style
members.descriptionHtml: CSS style to apply to the callout.

members.name: styles
members.descriptionHtml: Optional styles for the component.

members.name: target
members.descriptionHtml: The target that the Callout should try to position itself based on. It can be either an Element a querySelector string of a valid Element or a MouseEvent. If MouseEvent is given then the origin point of the event will be used.

members.name: theme
members.descriptionHtml: Optional theme for component
